alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Henry; Patrick (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 6:18PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Henry, northeastern Patrick, and southwestern Franklin Counties through 645 PM EDT... At 618 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Endicott, or 9 miles northeast of Woolwine, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bassett... Sydnorsville... Ferrum... Stanleytown... Endicott... Fairy Stone State Park... and Collinsville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for north central and northwestern North Carolina...and south central, southwestern and west central Virginia.
